comments.body: Maybe clean up this comment to explain why we need `error`s that aren't actually errors.

It feels a bit odd to be returning a `CertificateSigningRequest` as well. I like having the struct instead of raw bytes so we can easily evolve the API over time, but if we ever have a discrepancy between inputs and outputs, then we'll just be ignoring fields half the time. Why not create a `CertificateSigningResponse` instead so the inputs and outputs can evolve independently?
I think we discussed not adding a response api object in a conversation.
Is it possible to update the status in this error case, or do we only call UpdateStatus after a successful signing?
